column4: I can't open a file .php3 with Firefox, it asks me to Save the file, the file i want to open is /etc/freeradius-dialupadmin/config.php3, anybody can help?
Are you trying to open that file directly?

.php3 files must be 'parsed' to make sense in a browser... So they must be either served through a webserver such as Apache, or you can parse them manually with 'php /etc/freeradius-dialupadmin/config.php3 > result.html'.
but i can't find the php command
perhaps you have to install it with 'sudo aptitude install php'.
In the terminal, if you type 'php' and hit TAB, what happens?
hit TAB again and see if something like php4 appears...
Sorry but I think you better set up apache as well and put that file under your document root... :o/
i can't move the file because it uses another files, from diferent locations
how can i change the webserver from /var/www to /
You could try setting documentroot to that directory
I guess you'll have to edit httpd.conf and set DocumentRoot and the related Directory entries to the directory you want instead.
